content.description:
Researchers studying the bacterium Escherichia coli split a population of the bacteria into two samples. Sample <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> was transformed with a plasmid containing a gene that makes the bacteria resistant to the antibiotic kanamycin. Sample <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> was transformed with a plasmid lacking the antibiotic resistance gene. A portion of each sample was then added to growth plates containing just nutrients or growth plates containing nutrients and kanamycin.

After being allowed to grow for <math alttext="24" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>24</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> hours at <math alttext="37 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>37</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>∘</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, the number of colonies on each growth plate was counted (Table 1).

content.question: Which of the following claims is best supported by the data in Table 1 ?

choices.label: The transformation procedure killed all the bacteria that were added to plate <math alttext="3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

More bacteria on plates <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> were successfully transformed than on any other plate.
None of the bacteria on plate <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> were successfully transformed with the kanamycin resistance gene.
Only the bacteria that were successfully transformed with the kanamycin resistance gene grew on plate <math alttext="4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: Only the bacteria that were successfully transformed with the kanamycin resistance gene grew on plate <math alttext="4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.
